diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.about: Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease caused by parasitic protozoans.
riskFactors: Living in or visiting malaria-endemic areas

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.about: A bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, primarily affecting the lungs.
riskFactors: HIV infection, Substance use (such as injection drug use)
Specialized treatment for rheumatoid arthritis or Crohn's disease

diseases.name: COVID-19
diseases.about: COVID-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, cough, shortness of breath, fatigue, loss of taste or smell.
diseases.prevention: Vaccination, wearing masks, social distancing, hand hygiene.
diseases.treatment: Supportive care, antivirals (e.g., Remdesivir), oxygen therapy.
diseases.riskFactors: Older age, underlying health conditions, weakened immune system.

areas.name: Africa
areas.description: Africa is known for its rich diversity of cultures, landscapes, and ecosystems. It faces a variety of communicable diseases due to its tropical climate, high population density, and limited access to healthcare in some areas.

areas.name: Asia
areas.description: Asia is the largest continent, home to a variety of climates, from arid deserts to tropical forests. Its large population and varying healthcare infrastructure mean that both urban and rural areas are impacted by a range of diseases.

areas.name: Antarctica
areas.description: Known for its cold and barren environment, Antarctica does not have permanent human settlements, but temporary research stations could see cases of infectious diseases in rare instances.

areas.name: Oceania
areas.description: The smallest continent, also known as Australia, is home to developed healthcare systems, but surrounding island nations in Oceania face unique challenges, including the spread of tropical diseases.

reviews.content: please share more on affected areas
